creditline: Gift of funds from the Asian Art Council
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: cloth (wave) pattern overall; high shoulder with tapered body and neck, rim rolled; neck adorned by scratched banding; smooth interior, slip coated, unglazed
text: Although hand-built from coils of clay, this large vessel appears evenly potted with an elegant profile. The sides are impressed overall with continuous spiral designs created with a stamp. Similar jars of the Western Zhou period (1045-771 b.c.) have been excavated from tombs near Shanghai and farther south in Zhejiang province.
title: Storage jar
